Articles

Insider – May 7
Tariffs, casualty the biggest risks facing risk managers: Marsh’s Sartain
In casualty, getting significant blocks of capacity remains a major challenge.
 
Geopolitical and economic uncertainty have become key themes at this year’s Riskworld conference, according to Marsh US and Canada president Michelle Sartain.
 
“Many of the clients are trying to understand what tariffs are going to mean for their businesses,” the executive told this publication on the sidelines of the conference.
 
One of the ways in which the world’s largest broker is aiming to mitigate this risk is by adding capabilities to AI-powered supply-chain analyzer Sentrisk “so we can allow our clients to see their suppliers and the suppliers of their suppliers”.
 
This publication has reported extensively on the potential impact of increasing US tariffs on the P&C industry.

metadata.doc_id: C9RLLDC - marsh mclennan daily insights - may 8, 2025- quick read\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\C9RLLDC - marsh mclennan daily insights - may 8, 2025- quick read\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
This publication has reported extensively on the potential impact of increasing US tariffs on the P&C industry.
 
Casualty
 
Amongst a generally moderating rate environment in most lines and “improved coverage for clients”, casualty and auto lines continue to stand out as challenges, “largely based on the fact we cannot get social inflation under control”, Sartain said.
 
One way Marsh McLennan has aimed to address the issue is putting together facilities with “big blocks of capacity” through multiple insurers to ensure not only availability but more alignment on claims.
 
“Because what we were seeing is, as carriers were looking to reduce their exposure, they were limiting their layers, so, when there was a claim, they tended to tender them a little bit more quickly,” Sartain said.
 
Large line sizes should curb that behavior and “hopefully help reduce the size of the settlements”.
 
“Because, unfortunately, the precedent is really the thing that is challenging,” Sartain said.
 
This publication recently reported that a newly minted $100mn claims-made casualty facility from Chubb, Zurich and Berkshire Hathaway’s Nico, also designed to address the capacity problem in casualty, will require insureds to accept a 10% co-participation up the side of the tower.
 
Other lines
 
Property, which had seen the latest and most prolonged hard market after cyber and financial lines, has turned, Sartain said, in line with reporting from this publication.
 
“Really a welcome reprieve for our clients, who saw year-over-year increases and reductions of coverage,” Sartain said.
 
And Marsh is largely seeing clients use the savings to reinvest into other areas of their program or to offset some of the increases they might be seeing in other lines.

chunks.text:
And Marsh is largely seeing clients use the savings to reinvest into other areas of their program or to offset some of the increases they might be seeing in other lines.
 
This publication has asked how buyers might respond to finally moderating property rates and how they could adjust their purchasing habits amidst greater economic uncertainty.
 
One possible bright spot in the debate about the impact of tariffs is that moderating property rates could to some degree offset rising rebuilding costs, Sartain said, though she added that “we’re only one or two hurricanes away” from another potential rate inflection.
 
In financial lines, D&O has now largely given up all the rate gains made during its hard market from a few years back.
 
“Unfortunately, the claims have not gotten any smaller,” Sartain said. “There's still a huge backlog of losses to be paid by that market.”
 
M&A
 
The prospect for M&A in the US middle market through Marsh McLennan Agency remains almost “unlimited”, the executive said.
 
“The focus is, of course, on making sure we are acquiring companies that have a quality business with quality leadership, and that they feel like they can be better and more successful as part of Marsh McLennan than they'll be able to be on their own.”
Back to Top



 

Kev Keshishian- ACII -ANZIIF
